etymology.description: 公(公) (gōng, "public") + 司(司) (sī, "department; control") = organization for public service or business -> company
etymology.interpretation: A 公司(公司) (gōngsī, "company") is an entity that serves the public by organizing and conducting business or services. Historically, 司(司) (sī, "department; control") indicates a division in charge of specific tasks, implying administration or management.

examples.chinese: 我在公司工作(我在公司工作)。
公司今年业绩很好(公司今年業績很好)，员工们士气高昂(員工們士氣高昂)。
examples.pinyin: Gōngsī jīnnián yèjì hěn hǎo, yuángōng men shìqì gāoáng.
examples.english: The company performed very well this year, and its employees are highly motivated.
